programme.desc: Action from Serie A as struggling Pisa look to upset Luciano Spalletti's Juventus at Arena Garibaldi - Stadio Romeo Anconetani.

programme.title: Champions League Final 1993
programme.desc: We revisit the 1993 final between Marseille and AC Milan at Munich's Olympiastadion. The occasion was later overshadowed by one of the biggest scandals in the sport's history.

programme.title: Champions League Final 1994
programme.desc: A look back at the extraordinary 1994 final at the Olympic Stadium in Athens between Fabio Capello's AC Milan and Barcelona, managed by Johan Cruyff and dubbed the 'Dream Team'.

programme.title: Champions League Final 1995
programme.desc: We revisit the 1995 final in Vienna between Louis van Gaal's Ajax and AC Milan. A star-studded Ajax team featured Edwin van der Sar, Ronald and Frank de Boer, and Edgar Davids.

programme.title: Champions League Final 1996
programme.desc: We revisit the 1996 final between Ajax and Juventus in Rome. Juve's talented side included Didier Deschamps, Antonio Conte and Gianluca Vialli - all at the height of their powers.

programme.title: Champions League Final 1997
programme.desc: We revisit the 1996/97 UEFA Champions League final between Borussia Dortmund and Juventus in Munich. Armed with an expensively assembled squad, Juve were overwhelming favourites.

programme.title: Champions League Final 1998
programme.desc: Real Madrid went in search of their seventh European Cup title when they faced Juventus in the 1998 final in Amsterdam. The Serie A winners featured a 25-year-old Zinedine Zidane.

programme.title: Champions League Final 1999
programme.desc: We revisit the extraordinary 1998/99 UEFA Champions League final between Manchester United and Bayern Munich at the Nou Camp. Victory for United would clinch an historic treble.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2000
programme.desc: A look back at the 1999/00 UEFA Champions League final between Real Madrid and Valencia in Paris. Steve McManaman, signed from Liverpool the previous summer, starred for Madrid.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2001
programme.desc: We revisit the dramatic 2000/01 UEFA Champions League final between Bayern Munich and Valencia at the San Siro in Milan. Bayern were chasing their first title in a quarter-century.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2002
programme.desc: The 2001/02 UEFA Champions League final saw a star-studded Real Madrid face Bayer Leverkusen in Glasgow. The match featured arguably the greatest goal in the competition's history.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2003
programme.desc: We revisit the 2002/03 UEFA Champions League final between Juventus and AC Milan at Old Trafford. Paolo Maldini aimed to lift the trophy as captain, just as his father did in 1963.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2004
programme.desc: We revisit the 2003/04 UEFA Champions League final between Monaco and Porto in Gelsenkirchen. Jose Mourinho would leave Porto to take over at Chelsea just days later.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2005
programme.desc: The 2004/05 UEFA Champions League final saw Rafa Benitez's Liverpool take on AC Milan in Istanbul. The match would go down as arguably the greatest European Cup final in history.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2006
programme.desc: The 2005/06 UEFA Champions League final in Paris saw Arsenal face a pre-Lionel Messi Barcelona, then under the command of Frank Rijkaard, and featuring Ronaldinho in his pomp.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2007
programme.desc: We rewind back to the 2006/07 UEFA Champions League final at the Olympic Stadium in Athens as AC Milan looked to avenge their defeat two years previously against the Reds.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2008
programme.desc: A look back at the 2007/08 UEFA Champions League final between Manchester United and Chelsea at Moscow's Luzhniki Stadium, the first all-English final in the competition's history.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2009
programme.desc: A look back at the 2009 UEFA Champions League final between Barcelona and Man Utd in Rome. United were bidding to become the first team to defend the trophy in the modern era.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2010
programme.desc: We revisit the 2010 UEFA Champions League final between Bayern Munich and Inter Milan at the Bernabeu. Jose Mourinho was looking to become the third man to win it with two clubs.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2011
programme.desc: The 2010/11 UEFA Champions League final saw Manchester United come up against Pep Guardiola's Barcelona at Wembley, the scene of United's first European Cup success back in 1968.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2012
programme.desc: We revisit the 2011/12 UEFA Champions League final between Bayern Munich and Chelsea at the Allianz Arena. This was Chelsea's second final, having lost their last in 2008.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2013
programme.desc: We revisit the all-German 2013 UEFA Champions League final between Borussia Dortmund and Bayern Munich at Wembley. Bayern had lost two finals in three years.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2014
programme.desc: The 2013/14 UEFA Champions League final in Lisbon saw Real Madrid go head-to-head with arch-rivals Atletico Madrid. Real aimed to become the first club to win the trophy 10 times.

programme.title: Champions League Final 2015
programme.desc: We revisit the enthralling 2014/15 UEFA Champions League final between Juventus and Barcelona in Berlin. Barcelona were chasing their third Champions League title in six years.

programme.title: MotoGP Classics: Argentina 2018
programme.desc: A look back at the classic 2018 MotoGP race in Argentina, where British rider Cal Crutchlow raced to victory and Marc Marquez and Valentino Rossi collided in the closing stages.

programme.title: MotoGP Classics: Assen 2018
programme.desc: A look back at the classic 2018 Dutch Grand Prix. Marc Marquez came out on top in a race that produced the closest top 15 finish in the sport of all time.

programme.title: MotoGP Classics: Austria 2018
programme.desc: Relive all the action from the classic 2018 MotoGP race in Austria. Jorge Lorenzo came out on top of a wheel-to-wheel battle fellow compatriot Marc Marquez.

programme.desc: Barcelona: The Lewis Hamiltons of the future - alright, maybe that's pushing it - race their gravity-powered motors through the streets of Barcelona. Farcical crashes guaranteed.

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.desc: Who Do You Think You Are?: When a couple inherit a country house while unaware that it is teeming with ghosts, the spooks act to halt the new owners' plans to turn the house into a hotel.

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.desc: Gorilla War: Alison tries to ignore the ghosts' existence - but only exacerbates the problem - and Mike's attempts to turn the house into a home lead to a DIY disaster.

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.desc: Happy Death Day: Pat's family make their annual pilgrimage to the site of his death as he begs Alison to pass on a message, and Mike struggles with a bathroom-based paranoia.

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.desc: Free Pass: Alison tries to ensure that a shoot goes without a hitch when a TV company films a period drama in the house, and Julian tries his luck at betting on horse racing.

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.desc: Moonah Ston: Mike and Alison learn that some posh neighbours have an ancient claim over their land and throw an upmarket dinner party - with the ghosts' help - to help resolve an issue.

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.desc: Getting Out: A luxury hotel chain makes Mike and Alison a tempting offer, but the prospect of the couple's departure drives a wedge between the ghosts.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Clarkson, May and Hammond drive off into the sunset in the last episode to feature the much-discussed trio. The boys are up to no good as they test classic cars and 4x4s.

programme.title: Would I Lie To You?
programme.desc: Challenging each other to discern fact from fiction here are Greg Davies, Konnie Huq, Phil Tufnell and Marcus Brigstocke. With regulars Rob Brydon, David Mitchell and Lee Mack.

programme.title: Would I Lie To You?
programme.desc: Rob Brydon hosts the hilarious panel show where bluffs are continually called. Frank Skinner, Bill Oddie, Jon Richardson and Sarah Millican join David Mitchell and Lee Mack.

programme.title: Would I Lie To You?

programme.title: Would I Lie To You?
programme.desc: Comedy panel show with David Mitchell, Lee Mack and guests including Lorraine Kelly and Dara O Briain. With David's teddy in the firing line, host Rob Brydon feels protective.

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube Shorts
programme.desc: Rude Tube's naughty little sister presents more clips, this time with a twist of karma. Featuring a fall into a river, a penalty kick back and an attempt to get dressed on a treadmill.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Da Mimmo: Gordon tries to transform New Jersey Italian restaurant Da Mimmo, which is run by a mother and her three sons - two of whom see the business as a failure...

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Juicy Box: Gordon helps a Haitian juice bar and restaurant in Brooklyn. Jacques opened the Juicy Box to provide healthier options for the neighbourhood, but it's fallen into chaos.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Shall We Play a Game?: Adam accidentally gets Barry kicked out of his cool group of friends, but then comes up with a plan to get his brother back in favour.

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Family Takes Care of Beverly: Pops is evicted after starting a fire in his flat during a Halloween party, so Beverly invites him to stay in the family home.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Canine Mutiny: Bart buys Laddie, an amazing new dog, with a credit card that's accidentally been sent to Santa's Little Helper.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer's Enemy: A new power plant employee who's struggled to build a decent life is incensed that someone as foolish as Homer could seem so affluent. Bart buys a factory.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Three Dreams Denied: Bart becomes a voiceover actor. Comic Book Guy is humiliated at Comic-Con. And Lisa is set up for a fall.

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The Road to Cincinnati: Odd couple Skinner and Chalmers embark on an 800-mile road trip to Cincinnati for an administrators convention.

programme.title: Frozen II
programme.desc: (2019) The gang return for another magical adventure. Elsa must discover her destiny. And Anna, Kristoff and Olaf go along for the ride. Expect big laughs, bigger songs. But who's Samantha?

programme.title: The Simpsons Get a Fresh Start
programme.desc: Homer and Apu: E4 resolves to bring you ten episodes where characters try something new. In this one, Homer joins Apu on a pilgrimage to the original Himalayan Kwik-E-Mart.

programme.title: The Simpsons Get a Fresh Start
programme.desc: Hurricane Neddy: The Flanders' home is blown down by a hurricane and the Leftorium is looted. Homer leads the rebuilding project, but will Ned be happy with his new house?

programme.title: The Simpsons Get a Fresh Start
programme.desc: The Old Man and the Lisa: Mr Burns loses all his money and employs Lisa to help him earn back his fortune. But they don't see eye to eye over ethical issues.

programme.title: The Simpsons Get a Fresh Start
programme.desc: Pokey Mom: Marge notices a prison inmate's artistic talent and helps him to get a job painting a mural at the school. But he clashes with Skinner. Michael Keaton guest stars.

programme.title: The Simpsons Get a Fresh Start
programme.desc: Worst Episode Ever: Bart and Milhouse end up running Comic Book Guy's shop after he has a heart attack. And, while he recovers, Comic Book Guy falls in love...

programme.title: The Simpsons Get a Fresh Start
programme.desc: Hungry Hungry Homer: Homer goes on hunger strike when he discovers that the Springfield Isotopes baseball team are planning to move to Albuquerque.

programme.title: The Simpsons Get a Fresh Start
programme.desc: Please Homer Don't Hammer 'Em: Marge discovers that she has a gift for carpentry, but has to use Homer as a cover in order to overcome prejudices against women builders.

programme.title: The Simpsons Get a Fresh Start
programme.desc: G.I. (Annoyed Grunt): Homer accidentally signs up for basic training in the army. And Marge and Grampa get roped in when they try to get him released.

programme.title: The Simpsons Get a Fresh Start
programme.desc: Ice Cream of Margie (With the Light Blue Hair): Marge, feeling overshadowed by Homer's new career selling ice cream, starts creating ice lolly stick sculptures.

programme.title: The Simpsons Get a Fresh Start
programme.desc: E My Sports: When Bart starts earning money from video game competitions, Homer becomes his coach, and their team make it to the finals in South Korea.

programme.title: The Simpsons Movie
programme.desc: (2007) Animated comedy. When Homer's love for a pig causes world-threatening pollution, Springfield gets enclosed in a huge dome. D'oh! Will he do the decent thing and save his neighbours?

programme.title: The Inbetweeners 2
programme.desc: (2014) Comedy sequel. The lads visit Jay in Australia after he tells them he's living a life of hedonism and sexual promiscuity as a superstar DJ.

programme.title: Deadpool 2
programme.desc: (2018) Ryan Reynolds returns as the potty-mouthed, can of whup-ass-opening superhero and now he's got buddies to help him take on baddie Josh Brolin in the all-out action comedy sequel.

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Fallout
programme.desc: (2018) Tom Cruise stars in part six of the action-thriller series. His mission: to stop terrorists from getting their hands on nuclear bombs and unleashing global devastation.

programme.title: Funny Pages
programme.desc: (2022) Dark, adults-only, coming-of-age comedy about a troubled schoolboy who quits education to become a comic book artist - with the help of an array of questionable older men...

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Anastasia
programme.desc: (1997) Animated drama. When the Russian royal family is murdered, the sole surviving child is separated from her grandmother. Years later, conmen try to exploit the reward for her return.

programme.title: Monster House
programme.desc: (2006) Spooky animated caper with Maggie Gyllenhaal and Steve Buscemi. A young boy and his babysitter spy on the creepy neighbour. Did he really eat his wife?

programme.title: Miracle on 34th Street
programme.desc: (1994) Festive family drama. Richard Attenborough stars as a department store Santa who insists he's the real Santa Claus. But can he prove it in court?

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada
programme.desc: (2006) Comedy-drama starring Anne Hathaway and Meryl Streep. A naive young woman lands a job as assistant to one of New York's most important, but ruthless and cynical, magazine editors.

programme.title: Taxi
programme.desc: (2004) All-action thriller. Queen Latifah stars as the driver of the fastest taxi in New York, who teams up with an inept cop (Jimmy Fallon) to catch a team of female bank-robbers.

programme.title: See How They Run
programme.desc: (2022) Sam Rockwell and Saoirse Ronan head a splendid ensemble for this comedy whodunnit that places a real murder among a production of Agatha Christie's The Mousetrap. With Adrien Brody.

programme.title: Last Night in Soho
programme.desc: (2021) Edgar Wright's horror with Thomasin McKenzie, Anya Taylor-Joy and Matt Smith. A fashion student's transported back to Swinging-60s London. But nostalgia's not what it used to be...

programme.title: The Entity
programme.desc: (1982) Sidney J Furie's seminal horror stars Barbara Hershey as a divorced mother of three who becomes the victim of a poltergeist that submits her to multiple violent and sexual assaults.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Jingle All the Way
programme.desc: (1996) Brian Levant's festive all-action comedy. Arnold Schwarzenegger is on a mission to get his son (Jake Lloyd) the must-have Christmas toy, Turbo Man. But it's sold out everywhere...

programme.title: Deck the Halls
programme.desc: (2006) Comedy. Neighbours Matthew Broderick and Danny DeVito get extremely competitive as they festoon their houses with increasingly outrageous festive decorations and lights.

programme.title: The Black Swan
programme.desc: (1942) Swashbuckling adventure with Laird Cregar and Tyrone Power. Privateer Captain Henry Morgan tries to rid the Caribbean of pirates when he's made Governor of Jamaica. Bit rich.

programme.title: Little Women
programme.desc: (2019) Greta Gerwig's Oscar-winning period drama adaptation of the classic Louisa May Alcott novel, starring Emma Watson, Saoirse Ronan, Florence Pugh, Timothe Chalamet and Meryl Streep.

programme.title: Sleepless in Seattle
programme.desc: (1993) Romantic comedy with Tom Hanks and Meg Ryan. A bereaved man gets another chance at love when his son puts him on a radio talk show.

programme.title: The Equalizer
programme.desc: (2014) Thriller. Denzel Washington stars as an ex-soldier who comes out of retirement to help a teenage sex worker who's been assaulted by her pimp.

programme.title: Withnail and I
programme.desc: (1987) Richard E Grant and Paul McGann star in Bruce Robinson's cult comedy as hard-drinking, substance-abusing unemployed actors who flee to Cumbria to escape their squalid London life.

programme.title: Walking and Talking
programme.desc: (1996) Comedy with Catherine Keener and Anne Heche. A successful woman's best friend is getting married - making her feel unlucky in love. But is everything as rosy as it at first seems?

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: Teleshopping.

programme.title: The Lady Eve
programme.desc: (1941) Screwball romcom with Barbara Stanwyck and Henry Fonda. A con artist is forced to change tack when she falls for her mark and he dumps her for trying to con him in the first place.

programme.title: The Straight Story
programme.desc: (1999) David Lynch's fact-based drama with Richard Farnsworth. Alvin Straight drives hundreds of miles across the USA on a lawnmower to visit his dying brother - Harry Dean Stanton.

programme.title: The Golden Voyage of Sinbad
programme.desc: (1973) Can Sinbad stop a master magician from reaching the Fountain of Destiny on the lost land of Lemuria and being crowned the new leader of Marabia?

programme.title: Stormbreaker
programme.desc: (2006) Family action-thriller with Alex Pettyfer and Mickey Rourke. British intelligence recruit a schoolboy to take on the man who killed his dad and is planning to unleash a deadly virus.

programme.title: The Day the Earth Stood Still
programme.desc: (2008) Remake of the sci-fi classic with Keanu Reeves. An alien visits Earth to tell humankind to stop destroying the planet. But when he's attacked, he decides to eradicate us instead...

programme.title: Mission: Impossible - Dead...
programme.desc: ...Reckoning: (2023) Tom Cruise returns as Ethan Hunt and jumps a motorbike off a mountain for real. There's some stuff about an all-powerful AI. But it's the thrills that we're here for!

programme.desc: Liz Fletcher showcases her newfound passion for upcycling, crafting, and interior design in this Christmas special as she transforms an old stable block into a festive venue.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Ranvir and Richard are joined by the host of the world's first AI reality TV show, and Joe Wicks is in the studio.

programme.title: James Martin's Saturday Morning
programme.desc: James is joined in the Hampshire countryside by Gavin and Stacey star Joanna Page, master mixologist Merlin Griffiths, and chefs Francesco Mazzei and Jude Kereama.

programme.title: James Martin's Midweek Menu
programme.desc: James Martin serves up some of the best recipes from his Saturday Morning series, including a lamb hotpot that he cooked for Richard Coles and a dish from chef Wolfgang Puck.

programme.title: Grease
programme.desc: Classic musical film starring John Travolta and Olivia Newton-John, 1978. A good girl and a greaser attempt to rekindle their summer romance at high school during the 1950s.

programme.desc: The latest headlines from around the world at lunchtime with reports and analysis from ITV's Correspondents, all of which are followed by a national weather forecast.

programme.desc: The latest news and weather from the Midlands.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh hosts as Moyra from County Down, Sarah from the Wirral, Umar from Bradford and Ciaran from St Albans come together to try to take down one of the Chasers.

programme.desc: When Abi confides in Tracy about the state of her relationship with Carl, Tracy urges her to take drastic action.
